news.title: Lir release collection of early demos
news.summary: Listen to the new release below.

news.title: Black Stone Cherry announce Irish dates
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale Friday, December 12 at 10am.

news.title: 45 years ago today: John Lennon was killed in New York
news.summary: John Lennon was fatally shot in New York City on December 8, 1980. To mark his anniversary, we're revisiting his close friend and publicist Elliot Mintz's reflections. Mintz discusses his demons, his love for Ireland and his relationships with Paul McCartney and Yoko Ono.

news.title: The Late Late Toy Show Appeal has raised over €30m in total – as over €4.6m raised by viewers this year
news.summary: Donations to the RTÉ Toy Show Appeal remain open until December 19, 2025.

news.title: Live Report: Bricknasty take the 3Olympia to dizzying heights
Johnny Logan says he's proud of Ireland's decision not to take part in Eurovision
news.summary: "They say that the Eurovision is nonpolitical but the reality of it is when it is necessary it becomes political," said Johnny Logan.

news.title: Cliffords added to line-up of upcoming Gig For Gaza in the Grand Social
news.summary: Taking place on December 15, the gig will also include Esmeralda Road, Bold Love and more.

news.title: Gavin James announces acoustic shows in Dublin and Killarney
news.summary: Tickets will go on sale Friday, December 12 at 10am.

news.title: Remembering Sinéad O'Connor: Her final Hot Press interview – "Anger is the first step towards courage"
news.summary: To mark what would've been Sinéad O'Connor's 59th birthday, we're looking back at her last interview with Hot Press – originally published in 2020, around the release of her single 'Trouble of the World'
